column4: What's up with Ubuntu 11.04? It keeps crashing every few minutes and I didn't even install/configure very much.
The screen keeps going black, then shows the image again, then black, then the image again and I can't click on anything. When I get bored of watching that, I have to do a cold reboot.
There's also the dock at the left side of the screen that sometimes appears and it just won't go away. How do I hide it?
I would like to replace it with Cairo-Dock.
that is because the display drivers aren't installed properly
It worked fine for exactly two weeks.
So what can I do about it?
I don't tend to use non-LTS versions of Ubuntu
check your drivers are installed correctly if you're using either ATI or NVIDIA proprietary drivers
also keep in mind if you're using Unity, that it's quite a new desktop environment and is quite rough
Unity tends to expose bugs in a lot of drivers when running with 3D effects enabled
How do I know if 3D effects are enabled?
for Unity, you'd know if you've installed compiz
the GNOME 2 desktop is a very well tested environment, while Unity is still very new (think of it as akin to when Vista first came out!)
I chose Ubuntu Classic at the login screen. This is exactly what I wanted and I hope it will behave better. Thanks!
